title: Leo Sugar
text: Leo Tateusz Sugar (April 6, 1929 – September 23, 2020) was an American professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player who was a <a href="defensive%20end">defensive end</a> in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL) for the <a href="Chicago%20Cardinals%20%28NFL%2C%201920%E2%80%9359%29">Chicago</a>/<a href="St.%20Louis%20Cardinals%20%28NFL%29">St. Louis Cardinals</a>, <a href="Philadelphia%20Eagles">Philadelphia Eagles</a>, and the <a href="Detroit%20Lions">Detroit Lions</a>. He went to two <a href="Pro%20Bowl">Pro Bowl</a>s during his nine-year career. Sugar played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Purdue%20University">Purdue University</a> and was <a href="NFL%20Draft">drafted</a> in the eleventh round of the <a href="1952%20NFL%20Draft">1952 NFL Draft</a>. He was born in <a href="Flint%2C%20Michigan">Flint, Michigan</a> and played football and basketball for the <a href="Flint%20Northern%20High%20School">Flint Northern Vikings</a> in high school as well as a local <a href="American%20Legion">American Legion</a> baseball team. He died in September 2020 at the age of 91.
